intro: Hieracium uralense, commonly known as the Ural hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including the Ural Mountains, and thrives in alpine and subalpine environments. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Hieracium uralense is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, cold climates.
